Title: Flowchart extraction from RPG based legacy systems
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rand, Department of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Department of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: The following paper describes a reverse engineering process in creating flowchart from RPG based legacy systems to measure it’s effectiveness in maintaining the system. The data for the research were taken from ten samples program in BankVision legacy system. The proposed solution consists of several steps with the goals to transform the source code into DOT language and render it using Graphviz. For each sample, a test script is generated and compared with existing scripts. The cyclomatic complexity is also calculated to see how complex the samples are. © 2016 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Cyclomatic complexity; Flowchart; Reverse engineering; RPG; Test script
